events.title: Signing of the American Declaration of Independence
events.description: Delegates of the Second Continental Congress began signing the United States Declaration of Independence, officially declaring America's independence from Britain.
events.significance: Marked the birth of the United States of America and the start of a new nation based on principles of liberty and democracy.

events.title: Adolf Hitler becomes Führer of Germany
events.description: Following the death of President Paul von Hindenburg, Adolf Hitler merged the offices of Chancellor and President, becoming the Führer and dictator of Germany.
events.significance: Marked the consolidation of Nazi power in Germany, leading to totalitarian rule and setting the stage for World War II.

events.title: The Marihuana Tax Act is passed in the United States
events.description: The United States Congress passed the Marihuana Tax Act, effectively criminalizing cannabis nationwide through heavy taxation and regulation.
events.significance: Initiated federal prohibition of marijuana, impacting drug laws and enforcement policies in the US for decades.

events.title: Iraq invades Kuwait, leading to the Gulf War
events.description: Iraq launched a full-scale invasion of neighboring Kuwait, triggering international condemnation and leading to the Gulf War.
events.significance: The invasion caused a major international crisis and resulted in a US-led coalition response to liberate Kuwait.
